result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Jackson County Case 2016CF45 - Count 8 DRI of this Clark County Case

Pre-trial conference on May 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on June 2, 2016 at 02:10 pm.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Leonard A. Boardman, appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson appearing in person in court.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 02:10 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 28, 2016 at 11:10 am.   Faxed defendant's notice to Jackson County.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant's Attorney Paul M Fredrickson appeared.  Defendant did not appear.  Believe that Defendant may be in Jackson County.  Will reschedule  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 11:10 am.

Defendant is not to be on or around the premises of W9482 State Hwy 95, Merrillan, WI   The defendant shall have no contact with S.S., T.N., or M.T of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Leonard A. Boardman appeared, pro se.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.    Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:40 am.
